hello: is there a way to move the /home to the / ?
what are you trying to do? Sounds like you're setting yourself up for trouble...
'sudo cp /home /home-tmp', then remove the /home line from fstab. Reboot in recovery mode, mv /home-tmp to /home and reboot in normal mode.
backup your /etc/fstab, so you can turn back if you change your mind
'sudo cp -a /home /home-tmp', then remove the /home line from fstab. Reboot in recovery mode, mv /home-tmp to /home and reboot in normal mode.
but you should do it after logging out of gnome, logging into a console and from a root shell (sudo -i)
what do i have to do than?
log out of gnome, log into a console, get a root shell with sudo -i. Once you have that, umount /dev/hda8 ; mkdir /mnt/hda8 ; mount /dev/hda8 /mnt/hda8 ; cd /mnt/hda8 ; cp -a /mnt/hda8/* /home/
then edit /etc/fstab and put a # in the beginning of the line that contains /home
